The bed was comfortable with fantastic pillows. We had a view of the pool and it was a bit of a thrill to count how many flights came in (I think we counted like 14 southwest planes in like 2 hours). Being said - could not hear the planes at all through the night. Nice dark room, very clean, comfortable, and it comes down to great service. I'll definitely stay here again. PS - If you're just staying on an overnight from LAX, stand under the red sign on the middle side walk - this is for hotel pick ups. A blue bus will come by displaying RADISSON LAX and that's the one you hop on to get there.

Reviews.Title: “.”
Reviews.Author: bigcat65
Reviews.Content: I stayed with Raddison LA Airport hotel for a day.I found it to be very close to the airport.They have a good breakfast buffet which is good for the tourist.It was $ 20 and had many varity.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle to LAX and near very reasonable car hire”
Reviews.Author: MHSG
Reviews.Content: After a late night arrival at LAX we were delighted when the free shuttle arrived very quickly to bring us to the hotel. Check in was very efficient and a room we had requested near an elevator had been held for us (# 932). It overlooked part of the airport so my husband enjoyed looking at the planes. The room was completely soundproof and very comfortable with 2 beds and all amenities. The refrigerator was not plugged in but I connected it and put in some perishable foods. Unfortunately it did not switch on .... as I found out the next morning. At check out I mentioned this and the very courteous person at the front desk credited us with the cost of breakfast by way of compensation. We had breakfast in the dining room. Although the buffet looked delicious ($17.95) we chose eggs from the menu which in fact ended up costing about the same with juice. The concierge (from UK) was charming and helpful as was the person who brought up a luggage cart and helped load our suitcases into our car. The car, by the way, we rented from Midway who are located one block from the hotel (they also have a shuttle from the airport). They charge about half the rate of the other companies and we got new Ford Focus. We were very happy with our stay at the Radisson and plan on staying again before our return flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Hotel, Los Angeles Airport”
Reviews.Author: zarir1147
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are average. Very convenient for Airport passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Good for my one night stay”
Reviews.Author: gjtrips
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay at two hotels near the LAX airport this night: this one and the Holiday Inn LAX (long story). This makes it easy for me to compare both of them under a similar perspective. Radisson wins in one aspect: location. If, like me, you are in a rush to come and go from the airport, this is an average place to stay. I find the service very good, employees treated me nicely and delivered to what I asked, so this makes up a little bit from some of the let downs in some areas. This hotel shows its age. Carpets, bed sheets, shower, it feels as if it needs some renovation. I would stay at this hotel again for one night, because of its location and service I got, but once it gets renovated, I think I could consider longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: nick c
Reviews.Content: stayed there for three days and it is definitely very good, good service, clean rooms, but it is a little bit far from LA downtown.

Reviews.Title: “It's fine if you don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: mojave_ben
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of the Radisson is that you can walk to it - about 7 minutes from Terminal 1. That means no waiting for vans, get some fresh air, etc. It's also about 15 minutes walk to In-n-Out down Sepulvida if, like me, you're into "animal style" burgers. I had a high room on the south side. I could see planes on approach but not really hear them. All in all it was quite quiet, except that the room fan was a bit noisy when set to "high". The AC shuts off when there is no key card in the slot by the door, so the south facing rooms may be hot when you check into them, and then you MUST run the fan high for a few hours to cool them down (AC is on the weak side). Room has a fridge. There is a Subway down the street. For much of the year some yoga dude runs training programs at the hotel and that means there are many vegan-types around, which the hotel caters to in a little eat/drink lounge in the lobby - though pricey, this is a nice healthy food choice (of course I ate those burgers... but it was great to be able to pick up some milk for my morning coffee on site). Staff were friendly. Guests, other than the yogis, is what you'd expect at an airport hotel. You're not coming here looking for a resort, right? So it's just fine for an airport hotel. The fact that it is the closest to the terminals is a big plus for me, as I hate hanging around waiting for the hotel vans.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: mgorel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a layover after flying in from Thailand and had to wait until the next morning for my connecting flight. shuttle was convenient, the hotel close so after a long flight really appreciated the location -- the front desk clerk was cheerful & helpful. Room was very basic but clean. I asked about express check out since I had to dash out for a 6 am flight the next morning -- they said just call the front desk, which I did. Never got my receipt though and had to make my flight. Two e-mails and two voice mails later (since I never seem to be able to get a real person) I still have no receipt -- not even an e-mail or phone call back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Nan S
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at the Radisson Hotel at the Los Angeles Airport. The customer service was amazing - Lora at Reservations was very helpful, Jamie the bellboy spent a long time explaining the services of the hotel, Lily offered excellent room service. This hotel is located very conveniently close to the airport and just a short walk to restaurants. The room was well insulated against aircraft noise and we slept well in the large comfy room. We were most impressed with the prompt service offered on the free airport shuttle bus. We would definitely stay there again as the drive to LA hotels in the city is not worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: hilton s
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed my stay.Everyone was friendly especially joy at concierge

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Los Angeles Airport LAX”
Reviews.Author: enzo1953
Reviews.Content: I have been in Radisson Hotel in Los Angeles Airport for one night in October 2011. The Hotel is ideal for a short stop between one flight and next one. Price is very convenient, room are clean and services are good. Only very bad point is WI-FI connection that is simply ridiculous, so if you need internet every day, don't go there. The connection to the airport is a 24 hour service with shuttle going forth and back every 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Radisson LAX!”
Reviews.Author: JKR44
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at the Radisson LAX. The hotel is outright disgusting. Check-in was a zoo. The room was dirty and ill equipped. There was hair in the toilet, the bathroom sink and the bath tiles were cracked, there were no cups in the bathroom, no cups or coffee for the coffee maker, multiple stains on the carpet and a musty odor. I can't believe the Radisson allows it's name to be associated with this hotel. It's rated 3+ starts on Hotwire; one star would be overly generous!

Reviews.Title: “The best Salmon dinner in long time :-)”
Reviews.Author: angelnor
Reviews.Content: You have to try the salmon dinner in the resaurant. It was the best salmon dinner in a long time, and I'm from Norway. We love salmon. :-) My waiter was Martin Ruiz, very good service, exelent :-)

Reviews.Title: “A bolt Hole for the Night”
Reviews.Author: Markpeter1
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 5th floor in a smoking room for one night after flying in from Honolulu, and before flying home to London. The check in staff were very friendly, we went to the bar for a quick snack and the barman was very helpful and the waiter was very nice too. We checked out just before 12 and we kept our luggage at the hotel before we had to check-in at the airport. The consiege was very helpful and helped us with finding a local pharmacy. The hotel could do with a refurb it's very dated.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value at LAX, love the sleep number bed!”
Reviews.Author: MDS41
Reviews.Content: You can't get closer to the airport, front desk and bell staff were excellent, price was right, room was clean and spacious, has a refrigerator. There is a shuttle to Manhattan Beach that stops just outside the hotel, round-trip fare is $5 per adult. There is a pool. We heard no noise from planes during the night. Free shuttle to airport 24 hours a day, and the driver on the trip we took hustled to handle all the luggage for passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Palmira Restaurant Radisson Hotel LAX”
Reviews.Author: Aloft
Reviews.Content: The hotel's main restaurant, The Palmira, has the best and most professional staff I've ever seen in the dozens of airport hotels I've patronized. The dinner menu is varied and contains several savory options. Felipe Chaidez is the most welcoming, intuitive, efficient, and attentive waiter who helped us select delectable fare from the menu. He and the other staff members, Reuben Rodriguez and Juan Loya, take their jobs seriously and with clear, visible pride. We feel really good enjoying delicious food (compliments to the Chef) that is served with Love.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly welcome, and walkable distance to the airport”
Reviews.Author: mikesterDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the last couple of nights at the end of my American holiday trip. The lady who checked me in was very friendly and welcoming, and very kindly gave me a map to show me how to get to and from where I wanted. The room was large, and the outside window was very well insulated (so there was no noise from the planes to keep me awake). The planes and runways are not that close but you can see them landing. The price I got was very good, so I was very pleased with this hotel. The only thing it didn't have was a coffee maker in the room. (but there is a coffee shop in the lobby). There was also a fridge (empty) in the room. There was also free copies of USA Today left on tables near the lifts. From the hotel it is about a 5 minutes walk to Terminal 1 (Southwest) at LAX, and then each higher number terminal (2,3 etc) would be about another 4 or so minutes walk further along. Also there is a shuttle bus that can bring you to and from the airport. (and once at the airport there is also a bus shuttle that goes to the Aviation Metro station on the Green Line, from which you can then connect to the blue line to Long Beach or up to downtown LA.) So for people without a car, this hotel can be an excellent budget way of connecting to both the airport and the metro system (which is what I did). I would definetly like to come back and stay at this hotel again, and I would recommend it to anyone needing a nice place within such easy access to LAX airport and also the Green Line metro.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: I have seen the Radisson name pop up on hotels that I would rate at a 2. I was a little reluctant with the Radisson at LAX but this is where my job put me up at. Front Desk service was great. I went to my room and it smelled like smoke although it was a non-smoking room. Please note that this hotel is not smoke-free. They immediately moved me to another room and the room was great. My view was only the airport but that was ok. Walls/windows seem to be sound proof. Heard airplanes only faintly (sounded like a quiet a/c unit going on every few minutes). Did not hear my neighbors or anyone in the hall. The best thing about this hotel is their cleanliness and service. Front Desk, Bell Hop, Concierge - everything fabulous. Great food in their restaurant with great staff. They took care of everyone like they were royalty. I have since gone back to LA on business and was put up in a different hotel. But when it came time to kill before my flight going home I went to the Radisson for dinner and took the shuttle to the airport. I joined their points reward because it's my plan to stay there again! A few notes: 1. Strip malls are close by for supermarkets, nail salon, and strip mall shopping (ie Kohls). 2. They will try to push for you to take their car service instead of a cab. I would say take a cab if you're going close by to save $. I even had a cab wait for me while I went to Walgreens for water and snacks and round trip was only about $15.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ngck2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson, LAX for 2 nights. After the 1st night, I noticed that the ceiling above the toilet seat had started to flak and crack. I was able to check into another room which was much better on a higher floor with minimum fuss. Overall, the room conditions are average, does not really do justice to the brand name associated with the tag Radisson. Nevertheless, the front desk service was good but the hotel could do with some renovations to their rooms on the lower floors. There are possibly better hotels around the area for the same price and I would recommend that you shop around for options.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Catz22
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Radisson a couple of times and would do it again. Rooms are clean and spacious and have been happy with the room service food. There is a subway just around the corner as a cheaper option. The greatest advantage is that it is close to the airport so it is not a long shuttle ride and it's in a good location (have been further down where you don't want to walk the streets).

Reviews.Title: “1960's Asbestos Hole”
Reviews.Author: TheSavvyScot
Reviews.Content: Take one crumbling late 60's asbestos filled palace, add a few dozen pieces of toasted Pottery Barn furniture, a generous portion of nutmeg latex paint, a handful of gold fairy dust, some sugar coated art, a pinch of kosher salt, and your new dump will be ready faster than you can say Jiffy-Pop. Obviously the economy derailed plans to tear down this hole, so a lobby facelift sufficed. The rooms are stuffy, smelly and clearly in need of a more experienced cosmetic surgeon. I changed rooms 3 times hoping that I would eventually get a Sleep Number bed that actually worked. I tossed and turned all night on my swollen polyester mattress, wondering WTF I was inhaling from the antiquated and noisy ventilation spewing in my face. It was impossible to even justify the $89 Name Your Own Price deal I got on Priceline,. My pet peeve is that ALL hotels are basically overpriced, but this joint is certainly n my Top Ten Worst Hotels list. They should just put bunk beds in the rooms and turn it into a Youth Hostel. Wait....just tear the dump down!

Reviews.Title: “littel for the money....very little”
Reviews.Author: Suckered
Reviews.Content: worn, tire and SMALL....our room was so small, it was commical.....interestingly enough, it had all the standard furniture that most Radisson have.....the bathroom was so small, for two people getting ready for a 3am checkout was interesting....hopefully not all the rooms are that size, Also....we stood in line for check-in over 30 minutes due to a large tour checking in in front of us, apprently it didnt go to well for them because they kept returning due to the keys not working....maybe hae a separate line for regular guests in situations like this??

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hotel - Serves its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice for an Airport Hotel, not where you would want to spend more than a night or two for a flight. The room was upgraded to a suite which was nice, nothing special but large and two bathrooms was helpful. The room itself had a nice bed, lacked any real amenities but really, this isn't a vacation resort, its a place to sleep. The counter staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Overall this hotel was better than the Hilton and Crowne Plaza which I have stayed at before flights previously. The 14 night valet parking package was 229 which included the room. If you need a relaxed hotel to rest before a long flight, grab a coffee and be on your way than this is a great hotel. The bar and restaurant were also nice to grab a beer and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson's Palmira Bar & Grill”
Reviews.Author: malazan824
Reviews.Content: If you're staying at the Radisson, or any hotel near by, my wife and I highly recommend that you give Palmira a try. The menu selection is truly wonderful. But what set the Radisson restaurant above others, is its staff. Specifically our waiter, Felipe, made our dining experience a pure joy. He was very attentive to our needs and a pleasure to talk to. Btw, did I mention the food? I had chicken and scallop curry stir fry, while my wife had baked chicken. Both were tender and delicious. The main reason we are writing this review is to give praise to Felipe for providing service beyond the norm. He was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “My credit card”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: The restaurant staff are very good, the food was great. When out of their way to get me a hot chocolate, the bar meals did not have hot choc on the list, so the guy called Abel went somewhere else in the hotel and got me a hot choc. Abel was the best staff person in the whole hotel. The windows are very dirty, can only find two power plugs one for the lamp and one for the alarm clock, so no where to plug in my phones or my laptop, so I took out the light so I could charge my laptop, so now no light doing everything in the dark other than the bathroom light and a desk light, still quite dark. The heated pool was cold. The worste bit was the check in person would not believe I had a prepaid voucher. i gave it to her, she had to go and ask someone else, but only did that when I said that i was going to ring my travel agency and get them to look into it for me. They then told me that they were only holding 25 dollars on my card. Then I checked online banking and found they were holding just over 108 dollars. I wont return to this hotel. Christine

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Hans S
Reviews.Content: Has stayed at this hotel several times and has always been pleased with the service they provide. Love the restaurant Palmira - excellent food and great service. Only downside is that their rooms are a little to the old fashioned style - and parking is in a grey area - only valet as they have not finished their new parkingstructure yet (3 years)

Reviews.Title: “Its the people not the place so much that really matters!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aussiebuffer
Reviews.Content: We travel from east coast USA and Canada to Australia every 3 months or so and the Radisson LAX is been chosen as our home away from home in LA for one simple reason-the people!!! The staff from the top down really care abouts their guests in an old fashioned but never forgotten way. If only that old fashioned hospitality could be found more often in todays world of travel. Yes, the building has been there for a while but every request has always been met quickly and with a caring atitude. Keep it up Cindy and Team!! Paul Hughes

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stayover in a location I generally dread to pass through!”
Reviews.Author: Angela Y
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my way from Australia to Canada and found myself pleasantly surprised! Generally I try to avoid LAX as a transit airport but this time I had a 'forced' layover and was surprised when I arrived at 7.30am expecting to be told that I would have to wait for a room to be ready and was very happy to be greated with a warm 'Good Morning'. Staff at this hotel all seemed to go out of their way to be very helpfull and friendly. The lobby coffee shop/bar service was excellent with unlimitted refills of iced tea (made at my request). Palmira Restaurant was excellent and the service so good I was having second thoughts as to where I really was! The friendly service, certainly made up for a hotel that does have some dated aspects (TV, Pool area, lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, average environment”
Reviews.Author: Kiwibc
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to New York when hurricane Irene hit and we were stuck in La for an extra day and a half. Knowing a lot of other people would prob be in the same position I had my fingers crossed we could get a hotel near the airport. I ended up getting the last room in this place for 170 dollars incl tax. I usually check trip advisor before booking anything but given the circumstances I hadn't done so. When I did log in in their free wifi I was a bit worried given the reviews. Our room however was OK. It definately was a bit run down and the toilet wasn't the best(it got blocked and was promptly fixed) nor were the windows that clean but it was quiet and the staff were excellent. Very warm and friendly. I'd give the staff a 5 out of 5. The hotel itself only a 3 hence my overall score of 4

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the airport”
Reviews.Author: GBMember
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel at the airport in LA, and my travel agent chose this. It was very suitable. Check-in was friendly and efficient. The room was quite big and very clean - except for the windows were which spectacularly dirty. I could see the runway from my window, but there wasn't too much noise. The bed was comfortable and I slept much better than I had expected. Room service was very quick and efficient. The food was expensive, but was very good. The concierge was pleasant and helpful. If I needed to stay at LAX again, I would be happy to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Ken S
Reviews.Content: If you need a hotel room when traveling through LAX, I highly recommend the Radisson. The staff is friendly and helpful. The cost for your stay is a bargin as compared to the other hotels and you do not have to give up ant amenities. The rooms are big and clean. Stop in at the Palmira lounge and ask for Trino! He will be your gracious host.

Reviews.Title: “Good 5 day stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: I was a bit frightened when i booked my trip thru Expedia without first reading the reviews for the hotel. I knew better but trusted Expedia. After booking a 5 day non-refundable stay I was horrified to read these reviews. Heading there with expectations of disappointment, I was pleasently surprised. The negatives I found to be true were the windows are super filthy and not able to be opened, the tv is from the '70's with only about 10 channels and pay per view movies are a staggering $15 each, the forced valet parking was $22 per day and you are still expected to tip. My room was clean, housekeeping service was great, the pool was very large and clean however they could really use new and more lounging chairs on the deck. I was under the impression that the rooms did not come with refridgerators so we used a makeshift cooler for our sodas; however on day two I was pleasently surprised to find a fridge left in my room at no charge and without even asking for it. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was able to have my boarding passes printed out free of charge by consigere. I did not eat at the restuarant or order room service so i cannot comment on that. The bed was newer and semi comfortable. I did a thorough bed bug check upon entering the room and was relieved to find none. Location of the hotel was great and it was not noisy at all. Sure it could use some updating as it IS an older hotel but I'm not that picky. Overall I was happy with the hotel and found it to be worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Orna12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a very long flight The location was morethan good and also the service Parking was very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory - but could do better”
Reviews.Author: mgbecker
Reviews.Content: We saw the hotel as the plane landed - that was nice. The lobby is very large, and a bit dated. Expected and received nice service - especially since the room first given us had a strong smell of mold, and visible mold around the air vent. We were switched to another room without a problem, and there was no problem there. The room was a bit small, and had 2 full beds, I expected queen or king. I did not ask to change again, because we were tired and traveling with 2 kids. The special feature of the bed that adjusts the hardness of the bed with the touch of a button was NOT so special when 2 people tried to sleep on the bed. For bigger beds there are two controls for L and R sides, but not on the smaller bed. We ate in the lounge and enjoyed really good service and meals. But, I liked least that the pool was closed and this wasn't communicated before I booked. Not sure if I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Mkualoa
Reviews.Content: Room I stayed in dated,staff very helpful.will stay again.Just update,more plugs ,very small bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for LAX Airport”
Reviews.Author: saraben
Reviews.Content: We flew in from London and spent the first night of our holiday at the LAX Radisson which proved to be a very good choice. There is a complimentary shuttle bus from right outside the terminal building, making for an easy transfer. The hotel is a bit "tired looking", but it had all the facilites you would expect from a Radisson. The children enjoyed the pool even though it is adjacent to the airport and so very noisy, but the room was quiet. We had one of our best meals ever in the Radisson Restaurant and the staff were fabulous. We will certainly stay there again next time we are in LAX.

Reviews.Title: “WAY TO GO RADISSON LAX!!! Accomodated over 450 people for a yoga training and did it WELL!”
Reviews.Author: TigerPancakes
Reviews.Content: I attended a yoga training held at this hotel for 2 months (April 2011-June 2011). We lived on-site for the entire time. By the time I left, I knew the names of all the staff and every nook and corner of that hotel. I can't say enough good things about the staff! They were wonderful and very very accomodating. The food provided at a food bar in the lobby was surprisingly good. I am not one for buffet style food, but it was actually very good and fresh. They used a lot of organic products and provided a huge array of fresh, alternative drinks like smoothies, wheatgrass, fresh squeezed juices, coconut water, and many more. Room service was great and was provided 24/7. Good for us as we were up at all hours of the night. I think may hotels would have a hard time accomdating this many people....especially this crowd, but they were super organized, prepared and ready to made changes as needed. WE also used all of their conference rooms for "lectures" and "clinics" and the mainballroom became a huge yoga practice room. Excellent facilities! THe rooms themselves were standard fly-through hotel rooms. Decent enough, nothing really stood out. The only drawback I could find in the rooms was the ventilation in the rooms....I doubt anyone staying there a night or two would even noticed, but when you are there for 2 months and have wet laundry drying in your room (we had to wash our yoga clothes out by hand most of the time in the sink for time's sake and by choice-the hotel provided washers and dryers). Our thermastat didn't seem to work. We had maintenance check on it several times, but apparently the problem was never resolved..it just got very very stuffy and humid in the rooms. I heard that they were going to remedy that as many rooms had the same issues. Again, if you are thinking of staying here for a few days, even a week, this is your place. Other than the ventilation, which is not the staff's fault, it's awesome! Other pros: -Car rental facility on site (separate from the Radisson and provide very very low rates)-II rented a car almost every weekend for around $36 TOTAL for one day with taxes and insurance. -24 hour shuttle to the airport -Separte shuttle to Manhattan Beach, which inlcudes stops at the Mall (with all your basic department stores, Whole Foods and a ton of restaurants) -There is a Trader Joes, a regular grocery store, like Safeway, two CVSs with 24 hour pharamacy, a medical clinic for walk in injuries/sick, Bed Bath and Beyond, 2 Starbucks, Panera Bread etc. -The local bus can get you anywhere from the stop near the hotel..I took it to Santa Monica..was a straight stop no changing of bus. -Krispy Kreme doughnut kiosk located inside the Crowne Plaza (about a 10 minute walk down the street -an awesome sushi kiosk located in the Crowne Plaza-some of the freshest sushi i've had and i've had a lot--it's a lone guy that prepares the sushi to order -he is only there from 5/6-10pm M-F or something along those lines. -The pool at the Radisson is heated -They have a bar/lounge in the lobby that servies food until 1am or something like that. I had the best burger ever there... Again, the stafff....EVERY SINGLE PERSON, whas wonderful! They take customer service to another level. I've stayed at 5 star hotels that have not come close to this type of service. As a side, my husband, coincidentally stays at this hotel when traveling for business as required by his company. He is only in a night at a time.....this is one of his favorite hotels for the location and convenience. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because of the ventilation for long term stayers.....hopefully they will remedy that soon. My husband says he has never encountered this problem there at all...so maybe it was just our floor?

Reviews.Title: “High rates but off course along an incredible bad service”
Reviews.Author: Gmoesp
Reviews.Content: To feel the service in this hotel you just have to arrive with a car so you can feel how thevalet service treats you like a bank robber while you just park your car...and not once but twice. Make a line to check in like you were in Vegas. You thought that was it....Noooooo, if you arrive late, lets say 9 pm please hurry to pick up a sandwich onnthe bar before they take them away. But the best part, reserve a room for three people, pay a $180 per night rate and wake up early so you can go to airport on time and hear on the restaurant thatyou have only one breakfast included. What??? But the reservation says breakfast i made a reservation having in mind breakfast and now we have to pay more or have breakfast on airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for transit and excellent view of LAX runways”
Reviews.Author: Cherokee235
Reviews.Content: I checked in after coming from Manila. The very friendly woman in the Front Desk made me feel happy about being there. She gave me a room high up with a view of the LAX runways and the room was very well fitted out to an executive standard. It had everything I wanted and needed for a comfortable stopover. I can easily recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Simply dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Rufus2215
Reviews.Content: The worst experience in over 20 years of travel. Why would an airport hotel rent out the penthouse suite to a private party until 2am. When we called the desk to advise of the excessive noise they just told it was a private party and they had rented the space until 2am. Then there was the moldy ceilings near the Aircon vents that another Trip Advisor also enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown hotel, renovation overdue”
Reviews.Author: janerikcarlson
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the hotel twice in connection with our holidays in California, it is safe to conclude that renovation is long overdue at the LAX Radisson. The rooms are small, smelly, unclean and totally rundown. Friendly staff and nice lobby, restaurant and pool area are positive elements - but do not stay there until it has been renovated!

Reviews.Title: “over-rated”
Reviews.Author: david7151947
Reviews.Content: Neither bedside light worked, water pressure in shower was weak, and none of the 3 computers in the business center would work properly. Wi-fi is not available without a fee. This hotel is not worthy of the star level it receives.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to Hand Over your Wallet!”
Reviews.Author: Fakapuna
Reviews.Content: What I Liked: Nothing In Different: Pillows/Towels/WiFi Disappointed: Rooms need upgrade/Restaurant Prices/Tube TV/Small Bathroom/Unfriendly Staff (Front Desk/Valet/Eatery)/PARKING/VERY NOISY HALLWAYS/Window in room was terrible to look out of. Neighborhood: OK at best, could run into some shady characters Additional Notes: The only option is to valet park your vehicle but it also cost $20 a day to do so. Between the parking charge, the valets with their hands out, and tax I spent $50 for two days at the hotel. I dropped my vehicle twice and had it retrieved twice. Either charge for parking or donâ€™t and let your valets make good tips, but both is absolutely ridiculous. Paid $8 for a terrible salad the size of a large ash trash Coffee is $3+ Also there must have been a baseball tournament taking place because there were numerous 12 to 14 year olds roaming the property. If I may be frank I would be embarrassed to claim one of these kids as my own. They were loud, disrespectful to other guests, and several extremely rude comments were overheard. No values these days. VERY VERY NOISEY HALLWAYS ALL NIGHT LONG I think a fair price is: $70 (You wonâ€™t come close to getting it for that)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but tired and in need of help”
Reviews.Author: cynmar61
Reviews.Content: we normally stay at radisson for a night or two on our holidays to the USA as the ol' stop over and recover from our long journey (from Australia) and this time hotel was noticeably tired. Our room was in need of repair - torn curtains and hinges on cabinets broken. The carpet also could do with a upgrade.. The service within the hotel was friendly but the Valet car service also needs some attention.. ourselves and watched other guests having to remove own luggage or load own luggage while the staff (who are their for this task) watched but were very keen to put the hand out for the tip.. Overall a disappointing stay and on our return prior departing USA we stayed down the road at the Sheraton Gateway (a little more) but finished holiday on a good note..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: Stoogeweb
Reviews.Content: Spent a long day in LA on business and looked forward to the Radisson experience for one night. Staff were all extremenly helpful and friendly from the doorman to the check in gal to the parking guys. Five stars to you all! Now to the room.......toilet ran all night, air conditioning was barely there, room had a not so pleasant aroma (urine?) and there was no remote for the TV. Tried to iron a shirt the next morning and the iron just leaked water all over my shirt (had to dump the water out and iron the shirt dry). Such a shame that the room did not live up to the reputation of the chain or the people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff, property needs an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: schnep
Reviews.Content: To a person, the staff members I interacted with at this hotel were kind and helpful. The blowdryer in my room broke, and someone was there to replace it within 10 minutes. Very impressive. However, the room itself was on the tattered side -- old carpet, dated furnishings, etc. And neither of the Sleep Number beds in my room seemed to work. Proximity to LAX can't be beat, but next time I'm in the area I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night when you land”
Reviews.Author: wolsy1
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 5 taking out two rooms in this hotel. We had just come off an 11 hour flight, and it had taken a further 3+ hours to get through immigration and get our hire car. By the time we arrived, we were all thoroughly shattered. We had a boot full of luggage and we drove up to the Valet parking ($21 for 24 hours), they seemed a little dumstruck as to what to do with the luggage, err, put it on a cart guys and we'll check in and tell you the room number! I did find them a little unfriendly when they realised that there was quite a lot, "you'll have to carry some or I'll have to get a second cart" the guy said...err ok, less of a tip for you then if we're doing half the work! But anyway, not to be deterred, we checked in hassle free. The two rooms were opposite each other, it was a little off putting to find that a tray of food was outside our room, that was still there when we left the following morning, but we were so tired did we care! Both rooms had fridges, although annoyingly, and we were too tired to realise until the morning, one of the fridges hadn't been plugged in so some of the food in there headed straight for the trash. Views were good, both got a look at the runway, with either the planes taking off or landing, and there wasn't any noise to be heard. It was clean and simple, what you want really for when you land, a good nights sleep to set you up for the rest of your holiday. Had another little run in with the bellboys/valet parking guys in the morning re luggage (to put it into persective, we had 4 not overly heavy suitcases, 1 small overnight case, 5 handluggage rucksacks, a travel cot and a buggy), we called up for the car, and asked them to put it into the boot for us. When we finished checking out, we found our car there out front, and all our luggage strewn all over the front of the hotel, they were the ones with the car key as well, and I'd pointed out the car and asked them to do it whilst we checked out and then got the kids in car seats. Finally when my husband came back they helped. This episode should'nt define the hotel, this may have been a one off, just something to bear in mind if you have a lot of luggage. All in all, a nice hotel, we stayed 3 years ago and they had a nice bar on the top floor which isn't there anymore which is a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Howellsey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very welcome after 14 hours of flying and 2.5 hours trying to clear immigration. The place was clean, the staff friendly, the food good and I loved the views out over the airport. The shower was a little worn and there were a few little faded patches, but the bed was comfy and I would be more than happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for stopover”
Reviews.Author: SwanbournePossum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the eleventh floor, which faced the airport runway, and was clean, quiet and had very comfortable king size beds. The hotel's surroundings and corridors were somewhat shabby but our room was fine. The personnel in the concierge area were very helpful and we were able to arrange some organised and independent travel with their help. In addition to some restaurants in the hotel (which we didn't try), there was also a small casual eating area in the lobby of the hotel - friendly and fine for a quick meal. There were some nice healthy options available. The swimming pool was a disappointment. The internet photo gave a good impression, but alas, in reality the pool was set in a very unattractive environment with lots of concrete and little shade. However, two other advantages of the Radisson were the regular free shuttles to the airport; every 15 minutes, and also the fun and interesting $5 tour bus shuttle that went to Manhattan beach. Manhattan was great for a stopover visit with a walk along the pier and through the town, and had superb places to eat. On the way we could have stopped at a couple of shopping centres if we wanted to. All in all, we'd be quite happy to do a transit stop here again, but not linger around the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.... Dont stay here.”
Reviews.Author: cillanilla
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have o paid attention to guest reviews but booked a room in a hurry, thinking Radisson cant really be a bad choise!? The review from Singbe, makes sence now that I stayed at the hotel, the room was poorly cleaned and very chabby, full of mold which to me is severe due to an asthmatic condition. My healthcondition got even worse when I got home, since this stuff tends to stay with you for a couple of days. To top this they served me hair with my breakfast!!!! The hotel is lucky, I was in a hurry that morning and for that resdon didnt find the energy to argue for the little compensation they would have given me, some things money just cant fix. My advice, DONT GO THERE unless you are left with no other choise. I was staying there to avoid traffic-jam, between 16-17 july.

Reviews.Title: “very adequate for a night before departing LA”
Reviews.Author: johnfromwollongong
Reviews.Content: our family stayed the night at the end of a holiday before leaving for australia. we had 2 rooms for our family. the rooms are old and need updating but clean. the rates were good and the large pool was excellent for doing a few laps. it is also close to manhatten beach (3 miles). it is also the closest to the airport being about 200meters to the south west airline terminal. I returned my rental car and caught the shuttle in to the airport. from the south west terminal -it is only around 5 min walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear, this is an apology for a Radisson!”
Reviews.Author: Singbe
Reviews.Content: Having used Radisson hotels in the past, we thought we couldn't go too far wrong. We arrived in the early hours, very tired, and looking for a room, and were advised by the night staff that they had just had a cancellation. Despite the fact it was 01.30 in the morning, the reservation assistant was adamant that he could not include breakfast or reduce the rate. We were also advised that we would have to pay a $22 valet parking charge! After some negotiation and dismay with this and the room rates, we were given a very small discount. How I wish we had found another hotel. We approached our room to find dirty glasses and coffee cups lying in the corridor outside, and it went downhill from there. Inside the room, we found a half consumed meal and bottle of water in the fridge, biscuit crumbs on the chair and table, and a 'sticky' pest control device underneath one of the beds. Far from there being a 'cancelation', it was clear that the room had recently been used and not been serviced. Only one coffee cup and water cup remained, there was no laundry bag, no glasses or cups in the bathroom, and the beds had not been made up properly. These were the almost forgiveable aspects of the airport Radisson. The completely unforgiveable, centred around the grey and stained net curtains, the stained bed linen, the cracked sink, the wallpaper peeling off the wall, and the socket hanging out the wall. The room was shabby and tired, with old fashioned furnishings, cathode ray TV, and was certainly not what I would expect for nearly $300. Added to this is the audacity to charge $22 or parking, and the valet parking service provided by individuals who openly tout for tips. Unfortunately, having travelled far with a half asleep eight year old, we were far too tired to take issue with the room that evening. We raised our disappointment the following morning with the reservation manager, Gandy, who was clearly dismayed at the situation, and offered an immediate reduction. We appreciate your efforts, Gandy, but this Radisson hotel needs to address the fundamentals of hotel value and service provision. I have no doubt that our room had been 'double let', having probably been used for a 'day let' or airline crew, and to then charge nearly $300 for an unserviced room is unacceptable. However, what is also unacceptable is the standard of rooms being provided at premium rates. This hotel has obviously seen better days, and needs a substantial refurbishment, but there appears little incentive so long as there is a lucrative airport traveller catchment market. Don't be fooled by the grand entrance and valet/concierge desks - if you have the choice, do yourself a favour and find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but hotel...hmmmm”
Reviews.Author: pstill31
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice here but the hotel itself needs an upgrade. The room was dingy and could not figure out the thermostat or the bed control. Too much work for a night's stay. Did order room service which was fast and good.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great!”
Reviews.Author: lovela65
Reviews.Content: The only thing I would not suggest is eating there since you can walk towards the back of hotel across the street and get more affordable eats there. Other than that, service was great, hotel was clean and staff was friendly...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and a great value”
Reviews.Author: rillct
Reviews.Content: My husbands birthday was July 2nd and I booked a dinner cruise on the Hornblower out of Marina Del Rey. I chose the Radisson LAX for the location and value. We contracted one of their referred drivers to take the 4 of us to MDR and pick us up. I was amazed at the great price of the transportation in a nice roomy town car. I was pleasently surprised of the 10 to 15 min drive. The driver dropped us off and picked us up right on time. We sure didn't want to drink and drive, this was super. We had appetizers and a drink in the lounge before we left for our cruise, I can't say enough about the special treat the Chef made for us. The bartender was great and attentive. The hitel was very busy with what looked like a large group, but we always were attended to graciously. The rooms were roomy and clean, beds very comfortable. I loved our view of the airplanes but you can't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Unfriendly Accommodations, Overpriced Parking”
Reviews.Author: BonesyBake
Reviews.Content: I expected a lot better accommodations than I received at the Radisson. I stayed here because Radisson is known for it's semi-luxurious hotels and accommodations. This hotel however, was a disappointment. The sleep number bed was extremely comfortable as I slept on one of the lowest settings possible and just sunk right into the bed. The room itself was large however the bathroom was as small as a coat closet with no room to move. The carpet was old and had rust stains or some other stains all over (mostly by the windows). The TV was from 1995. And when I attempted to call guest services or the operator I never got an answer. Room wise--I've had nicer and more updated rooms at Motel 6 for a quarter of the price. The staff was friendly and willing to help out wherever they could (or whenever I got them by phone). The free wifi in the room was extremely slow and the free print from your own computer service to guest services printer was not working. So I had to go down to the business center and pay $7 for 15 minutes of internet time. Tried to print my boarding pass from the same computer and could not do it because it blocked pop ups and these computers would not allow you to change that setting. The valet parking attendants were extremely nice although I was very upset that parking was $20 per night here and there were no other options available. Overall this was an average hotel experience but a subpar Radisson experience.

Reviews.Title: “Your typical airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: saber45
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights the first of July 2011. It met my needs when searching for a hotel close to LAX. Free airport shuttle, lobby bar, restaurant and walking distance to rental car companies. My wait to check-in was minimal and was greeted by a friendly staff person. I stayed on the 10th floor but there were four elevators so my wait time for one was usually under a minute. I also walking about 10 minutes for an In-N-Out burger for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “GET RID OF THE VALET”
Reviews.Author: growl73
Reviews.Content: so many complaints about the valet parking on here. simple solution. get rid of them and people can park there ownrs without the need for them,its not really a problem for customers to park there own car as they do it everyday, and paying to park your car at the hotel your staying ?????? well there will be a charge to use the toilet next, it should be free !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, always helpful. Bikram Yoga Teacher Training held there for 9 weeks!”
Reviews.Author: anislandwoman
Reviews.Content: In the 9.5 weeks I spent there, the staff was always helpful from the front desk, concierge, security, facilities, room service to housekeeping. My requests were met with patience & willingness. Never a cross look or word when I asked for extra blankets or disputed charges on my bill etc... I had a lot of contact with Steffen Meckbach and Luis Bermudez and they managed to meet all requests in a timely manner - more towels, adjustments in room temperature, ice for 430 people every day, twice a day, etc.. I'll be back! Free WiFi but high speed comes at a price. Hotel is walking distance from restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy Hotel, Beware!”
Reviews.Author: anchoragedaddy
Reviews.Content: The minute I stepped out of my car into the valet parking area, the stench of cigarette smoke hits you like a brick, so nonsmokers would never enjoy this type of reception. Valet parking is required, unless you want to park 1.5 blocks down the street. cost is 20.00 for the night. The hallways smelled of cigarette, even though there is no smoking indoors, the room was damp and musty, appeared dirty, the toilet backed up, there were 2 sleep number beds which didn't work well, we slept on them anyway and awoke in the morning with back pain. The beds were the absolute smallest double sized beds I had ever seen in my LIFE!! I felt like one of the seven dwarfs!! The decor was ugly, and the paint on the wall was dirty and in need of spot cleaning, the pillows were flat as a board, the carpet dingy and damp to the touch. The staff was nice and friendly and apologized for us not liking the room and the maintenance guy was quick to fix the toilet, which was nice. Overall this room was a complete disappointment. I wish I would of stayed at the Hilton or Sheraton a couple blocks over. I dare say even Motel 6 has a heads up on this place. Clearly it is a dump running under false pretenses, as Radisson is supposed to be associated with luxury, not filth. First & last time I EVER waste any money and my precious vacation time here!!

Reviews.Title: “These other reviews had me worried!”
Reviews.Author: shores1
Reviews.Content: But when we arrived, there were smiling, engaged staff to take care of us. Our room is on the 7th floor. The king bed is great. There may be only valet parking right now but it's only $22. The Marriott down the street is $32. We just stayed there. As far as age, name a hotel on Century that doesn't show some age. Do I wish the TV was a 52" flat screen on the wall? Sure. Do I wish they had Showtime so we could see the premiere of Weeds tonight? Sure. But overall this is a great room at a great price if you priceline, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay for a Two Day Layover to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: I_Love_2_GoKy
Reviews.Content: We broke up our long flight to Hawaii from Cincinnati by staying in LA for two days. We wanted a central location that we could see the LA sites but be close to the airport for our early departure flight. Despite the hotel being right next to the airport, we never heard any airplane noise in our room. The facilities were clean, but nothing fancy. The concierge was very helpful in helping us book a bus tour of LA and advised us of the famous In and Out Burger joint just a short walk from the hotel. We ate breakfast at the main restaurant's buffet and it was excellent. Having the free airport shuttle kept us from having to rent a car, and using the car service to take us to Venice Beach and Santa Monica pier was well worth the $30 fare, so much better than the $50 cab ride back. The tour bus company picked us up at the hotel. Negotiate on the price. When I called from the airport, the rate was $140. I kept knocking them down on the price and got the room for $89.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to Presidential Suite.”
Reviews.Author: kealohanui
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for all our LAX departures. I made a last minute reservation for June 17 for one night. for four (myself, two college-aged sons and my 13yo). I wanted a two-double non-smoking preferably on a high-level floor to avoid traffic noise. When we arrived at the hotel there was only one two-double non-smoking room available on the 5th floor, but it was next to a smoking room. I asked if I could get a two-double room on a lower level. The desk clerk told me he had to check something and left, when he returned he said he would move us to a presidential suite with a complimentary roll-away at no extra costs. He was very friendly and regret I didn't get his name. We stayed in room 1247, with a living room, separate room with a king and two full bathrooms. I particularly liked that the king was a sleep number bed, so I got to set it at the setting I have at home. I would've never known it was a sleep number until my 13yo found the remote. As with every hotel, I previously checked bedbugregistry.com for updates on this hotel and found no reports to date. I still checked for bedbugs in our room and happily report there are none in the room we stayed in. The only drawback was parking. I neglected to read latest reviews and found we had to park in a makeshift parking structure guarded by not-so-friendly attendants. The parking is located northeast of Radisson with inadequate street lighting. This made me nervous as we had to cross two streets after midnight. Apparently, Radisson overnight parking is undergoing some construction. The cost of overnight parking was $11/day flat-rate. I wish I paid the $20 for valet. We didn't use Restaurant, Room Service or Swimming Pool this time. Overall, I like the convenience of location and the familiar grounds of the this Radisson hotel. With the exception of the parking, I consistently found the staff to be friendly and helpful. I will continue to book my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stranded by Delta - great place and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: bazingaLV
Reviews.Content: Stranded for the night thanks to Delta being 5 hours late (from LAS VEGAS no less!!!) and our flight to Fiji only flew once a day - missed it by 15 minutes. Uhg. Wanted a place clean and inexpensive close to airport - and i am glad we picked the radisson! Rooms are clean - missing convenient power outlets. Not all rooms have coffee pots. Need to go outside Lobby to smoke. Free wifi in room, ask front desk for free lobby wifi code. DO NOT take taxi from LAX! $17.50 mandatory charge for 4 minute drive. Courtesy shuttle runs every 15 minutes :) Terrific and helpful staff - also NO airport noise (maids on the other hand - we had a late checkout, peeps kept calling our room at 10 am and hanging up) left room to have a smoke and noticed someone took do not disturb sign from door) they were also yelling at each other in the hallway. Other than that - Daniel at the front desk was wonderful at checking - restaurant and bar staff excellent (as was food). Don't use sleep number beds if you are not used to them! Takes more than one night tio figure out "your number" - and waking up was painful. Will return if we are ever stranded by Delta airlines again :)

Reviews.Title: “closest to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Antinmelb
Reviews.Content: this hotel was OK, my international flight arrived 3 hours early and they let me in to my room at 10 am. room was a good size fairly standard and comfortable, the position to the airport was great. Staff were helpful, good to have internet, not much choice of food nearby but a fair walk away. The windows are triple glazed so there was no noise from the airport but the outer layer needs replacing so that the view is better. would I stay here again, yes I would.

Reviews.Title: “slowest FREE wireless unless you want to pay for faster”
Reviews.Author: travlermb
Reviews.Content: FREE wireless was slower than a dial up modem, but feel free to pay extra for faster speed. also.....stained carpet, broken lamps, peeling tub and shower surfaces, slamming doors, etc, etc, etc. Just stay elsewhere, there are a lot of options at LAX

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL NEEDS UPDATING”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolBob1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok --good base for los angeles .The hotel really needs a good update it gets a lot of use which shows .The pool area looks great on the photograghs but i would not swim in it.Iwould stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back”
Reviews.Author: WeekendTraverer
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before a few years ago and thought we knew what we were getting. We were there for a two night stay before heading south to the San Diego area. A couple of surprises that turned us off to returning here when we are in the area. As soon as we arrived we found out that the parking garage that was almost complete a few years ago was still not done and our two parking choices were either use the valet or park very far away. Since walking a couple blocks to get the car each time we needed it was not an option we had to pick valet, which is nice but added more expense to our stay. The second thing was Friday morning we decided a nice soak in the hot tub to start our morning sounded good so we headed to the pool area around the construction only to find a palm tree planted in the former hot tub...fortunately the heated pool was actually heated so we did get in a swim instead. The lobby is nice, as are the sleep number beds but the rooms are clearly dated, the ceiling needed a good painting and the windows were dirty and looked like they never get a good cleaning. This place is just not that great for a Raddison hotel. Next time we will be trying the Marriot instead.

Reviews.Title: “First Time at LA Airport”
Reviews.Author: kaowinston
Reviews.Content: Generally, I always ignore airport hotels. But this time it was a very good deal. It was my third time at a Radisson, and I knew what to expect. The room was spacious, and the facilities were excellent. I had to travel a little more to get to my destination, but that was OK. The week was more than enjoyable, and I will do it again. The only item I missed was a refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room but Inconvenient Valet parking”
Reviews.Author: NguyenNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: Expensive valet parking but other then that the hotel is a great stop near LAX airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pitstop!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FerryArab
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to others on here - some folk must be fussy as hell. We stayed here after a 22 hour journey and were only looking for somewhere to put our heads for a good nights sleep before hitting the road the next day. We got exactly that and more. Comparing it to the UK travelodge where we stayed the night before, which was a similar price well, no comparison really. Really nice hotel, room was nice and clean, breakfast was great and reasonably priced. Most importantly, considering this will be primarily a lay-over hotel, the beds are really comfortable and the noise insulation is brilliant. Right at the airport and there was zero aircraft noise. Couldnt even hear any noise from the freeway which was literally underneath our room. For what we paid for the room - we were very happy. Best till last - VERY impressed with what can only be described as the most trustworthy housekeeping staff ever!!!!!! I made a monumental cock-up and left a signifant sum of money (all of our holiday spending money) behind after leaving the room. We realised halfway to our next destination and called the hotel to be told housekeeping had the found the money and it was there for me to go back and collect. Good to know that the hotel employs honest staff.

Reviews.Title: “great pitstop.”
Reviews.Author: Jegan_T
Reviews.Content: Was there for a stopover. Arrived late evening after a 21H flight. Was hoping for a nice comfortable sleep before a connecting flight at 730am. Thats exactly what we got, a short trip from LAX (10min) with the shuttle transport which was free and a quick check in. The bed especially was awesome. You get to select your preferred setting and the type of pillow. The windows were well sound proofed so although you see the airstrip just down the road, you hear nothing. We slept like babies and we were fresh for the connecting flight.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Alida24
Reviews.Content: Room was basic, housekeeping not so good. Not nice to see someone's fingernail on the carpet and hair on the bathroom floor. Was supposed to be non-smoking room but there seemed to be a constant smell of cigarette smoke wafting around. Went to the bar for a snack about 6pm and was told they had nothing left. Not even a packet of peanuts. Restaurnant food not too bad. Hispanic wait staff seemed more interested in getting a tip rather than offering good service. Main course came out with the entree which was rather strange. Should have sent it back but when one is fatigued you can't be bothered. Guess that is what this hotel relies on.

Reviews.Title: “Bad relationship cost versus benefit”
Reviews.Author: gmg1010
Reviews.Content: The hotel does not have major worries in dealing with guests. First mistake at check in: we were in 4 and the reception gave us a room with only one bed (despite I remembered the guy at check in) - we had to change room late of night with a lot of lugagge. Rooms without minibar (at least mine) and a expensive 22 dolar day cost for parking. I will not be back

Reviews.Title: “Average Room, Decent Stay, No Problems”
Reviews.Author: Graygab1
Reviews.Content: Booked room on Priceline.com for $55/night. Stayed 2 nights. The staff I encountered were nice, despite the reviews. Check-in process was moderate. Stood in line about 5-10 minutes or so, but no issues. We stayed on 7th floor... elevators were fast and in good repair. Room was comfy, beds are a bit small but slept well. Some minor detail repairs needed (see photos) but it didn't affect my overall stay. Didn't hear any noise from airport or through the walls. Shower gets hot, bathroom was clean. WiFi is free!!!! Shuttle to airport runs every 15 minutes. It only takes 5 minutes to get to the airport, which was convenient. You can order tasty food at the bar (see photos) for less than $10. Drinks were good. Price $$-$$$ Hotel restaurant has a good breakfast buffet, but it's about $15. You're better off eating in the bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, Expensive Valet, unfriendly check-in”
Reviews.Author: annoyed3
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room from their website on-line deals that didn't indicate the bed size so I made a written request for a King bed on the order. At check-in my request was not even acknowledged and when we got to the room there were 2 full-sized beds. It would have been nice to atleast be informed that they could not fulfill the request. Before that though, our check-in agent seemed annoyed or inconvenienced by our arrival and was very curt with me in response to questions about parking. As it turned out, the parking is valet ONLY for an additional charge of $22. There's absolutely NO onsite parking for free. This bit of information is not clearly stated on their website either. Perhaps this will change after this review. Other than those inconveniences and unprofessional personel, the room was clean and in good condition. The extra pillows were a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived at 1 a.m.--toilet did not work”
Reviews.Author: lapoche
Reviews.Content: We were in LA on an emergency and needed a place to stay late at night and at the last minute. First of all, getting discounted internet rates seemingly anywhere in such circumstances was impossible. We arrived at the Radisson at about 1:00 a.m. To our surprise--our fault for not thinking to check in advance--the only parking was down the street for $10 or valet for $20, an expense we had not counted on. The sole desk clerk was on the phone, with one customer at the desk and two waiting. Eventually, another desk clerk came on duty and was quite pleasant. The room was fine, but the toilet would not flush. Not wanting at that hour to wait for motel help, we tried and were successful in fixing it ourselves--the water to the toilet was turned off. Needless to say, having a nonworking toilet, at any hour, is inexcusable. Due to this, the slow desk service, and the parking expense, we will avoid Radissons in the future.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS !!! RUN AWAY FROM THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: davidps28
Reviews.Content: not sure what else to say other than i have horrible welts on my body and am scared that I brought them back to my house. The night I checked in there were no lamps on the end table, no ironing board, clock was wrong and the television was broken. I think the room was off limits and they gave it to me anyway.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID IT IF YOU CAN”
Reviews.Author: Barcenas-Vazquez
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this property last year and apparently they must have given me a nicer room back then. The room I got this time was old, tiles torn and coming off the ceiling, the linens were old, worn out, rough and dirty looking and had a horrible cheap detergent smell. Got a standard room with double bed that was extremely uncomfortable, you could feel the coil and springs from the matress. The heater and AC unit did not work. There was also a scary fight down the hall on the 4th floor at 10:00 pm when I arrived, the people in that room were drunk, beating themselves up and running out in the hall ways, screaming an yelling. The downside too was the there was no parking, the only option was valet for $22 a night. Front desk only had two people checking in at 9:00 pm and the line wrapped all the way to the front door. The only good part was that the shuttle service to the airport was on time, driver was very nice and helpful. I honestly don't recommend this place at all, it's truly a DUMP. Save yourselves the agony and find another place that is more decent.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better--a smoky "non-smoking" hotel”
Reviews.Author: klscaz
Reviews.Content: When we called to complain about the smoke smell, they offered to have somone come and spray the room. Oh yeah--that would really help my allergies! The restaurant was very expensive. We ate dinner next door at the Courtyard. On the plus side the airport shuttle was on time in the AM and they have a Starbucks on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Jetlag pitstop”
Reviews.Author: moruya2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night last month. We flew in from Australia at about 8AM and after the 14 hour flight stayed here until we had recovered from our jetlag. Its the closest hotel to LAX and an easy walk along a smooth concrete pathway. Should you not want to walk, there is an excellent shuttle service too, between the Hotel and all the terminals. We weren't able to check in until 3PM which wasn't a problem, as we left our luggage in secure storage in the lobby. There is a trolley bus that makes curcuits every half hour to Manhattan Beach, so we bought a ticket on that and headed off until we could check in. The room was large, clean and being on the 11th floor on the northern side, it had great views of the aircraft operations. The TV was old, but worked. The bathroom was clean and well equipped, but I did notice some grime/dust around the air extractor vent. The important thing....the bed. It was GREAT. Very welcome after our long flight. We ate in the bar. Good food served well and with good prices. Check out, like check in was smooth and the staff were curtious. For what we wanted it for ( getting over jetlag) this hotel was perfect. Should we ever be in need of accommodation at LAX in the future, we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A backward hotel with unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: maziDeniliquin
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here, arrived early around 9.30 am, told maid service only started at 9 am and I had asked for early check in, receptionists rude and uncooperative. Woman at tour desk lovely and helpful. No offer of assistance with luggage at any time, I carried in my own bags as the porters were all busy with a large no of departing guests. Breakfast poor and over priced. The worst part was the lack of modern internet. Computers were very old, very slow, and at $7.50 for a quarter of an hr, very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: Oztravels7
Reviews.Content: I arrived after a long flight from Sydney and on arrival went to checkin and was told "no rooms until 1.30 when housekeeping release them to us". I had arrived as the same time as another gentleman on the free shuttle from the aiport but was behind me in the queue to checkin and so watched what happnened to him. Low and behold they gave him a room in 30 minutes and after confronting staff about this, they had a room for me. Anything you aked the staff was too hard to answer throughout the stay. The worst hotel staff attitude I have ever experienced!!!! Avoid this hotel at all costs if you are looking for service at all! The rooms are ok and clean and it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “No respect for time”
Reviews.Author: Aman-India
Reviews.Content: 1) Waited at airport for shuttle - 30 Minutes. 2) Waited in line for check in - 15 minutes 3) Came early - Waited for room - 2 Hours. Then rooms are comfortable... stay was good later on...

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card Bill carefully!!”
Reviews.Author: FairfaxVaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Look, this isn't a review about their ammenities. As far as bed, and facilities go, this is a decent hotel, but the jerks who run the billing and accounting for this hotel should be fired. I booked the hotel for a stay in April - it was a regular booking, no special discounts or conditions - they charged my credit card immediately and in full more than a month before I had the reservation scheduled. I had to cancel.....weeks before the arrival date and in full compliance with their cancellation policy - I have still not receieved my refund to my credit card and dealing with their accounting department amounts to leaving a message on their voicemail and never receiving a call back - these people are total incompetents and I'm now pursuing a refund providing all the relevant documentation through my credit card company because these idiots at Radisson are incapable of providing the assistance and customer support ANY other hotel could - their accounting department at this hotel is staffed by a bunch of incompetent screw ups - be very careful booking at this hotel and watch your credit card statement very, very carefully. These people are not to be trusted.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all cost”
Reviews.Author: jsaylor18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived last night at the American Airlines terminal and phoned the Radisson (where we had a reservation) for transportation. The operator told us the van would be there in 20 minutes, and we stayed at the Red Hotel loading zone. The van took 20 minutes, and when it arrived, it stayed in the third lane away from the loading area and did not stop. I ran out in the road and waved, he waved back, and indicated he was full. I called the Radisson again, and 3 times got the message "the operator is not avaialble - call later". When I finally reached the operator, she did not apologize, just said, "The van comes every 20 - 25 minutes". When I pointed out that it could be full again and asked if she would reimburse for a cab, she said, "No". When I complained again, she said "We are close to terminal 1 and you can walk". When I asked her how to get from Terminal 4 to Terminal 1, she said, "The van comes every 20 - 25 minutes". I am 65 years old, my wife is 60, and we decided to walk the 1.2 miles with our luggage. When we got to the hotel, the staff apologized, and told us to complain to the van service if we wanted to complain. It was after 8 PM (10 PM at our home in Texas), and we said we were hungry - we were pointed to your restaurant (which was quite good). I know mistakes happen, but the hotel has a "100% Guarentee", and no one offered to comp the room, upgrade the room, or even a voucher toward the cost of a meal. The staff supevisor on duty when contacted by desk staff offered nothing. The manager on duty had gone home sick for the night. The room has a great bed, an old 27" TV, very cheap furniture and plastic glasses. This is hardly a 3 star hotel, and even making allowances for its great airport location, is not a place we would ever stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A relic from the 70s”
Reviews.Author: ronaldo123
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I could say about this hotel was our check in and out was hassle free, plus the shuttle to the terminal is fast. The only reason we stayed here was for an early flight (check out my other review for preferred place to stay in LA). Opening the door to our room was going through a time warp into a tired motel from decades long gone. The bed (a small double not a queen!) was disappointing. The TV was ancient. Bathroom was small and poorly equipped (just two towels). The aircon/heater was incredibly noisy and I just ran it while showering before bed - it would have been impossible to sleep with it on. As we'd arrived late and only had about 6 hours to sleep before our flight I didn't want to waste time asking for a better room. The view from our upper-level room would have been good (of the runways) if it wasn't for a dodgy tinting film that was bubbling and peeling. No aircraft noise, external sound insulation good.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but past its prime”
Reviews.Author: EquineDoc
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and a bit worn. For an airport hotel, however, it was reasonably quiet. The sleep number beds are awful -- glad I never bought one! There was a huge line up at check out. But I am glad I waited -- there was a restaurant charge on the account that was not ours.

Reviews.Title: “Don't arrive late, you will wait forever!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadnonstop
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 9:45pm, in a hurry to check in because i had a 6:00am flight the next morning. I was amazed that there was a long check in line, and only one clerk. After waiting 15 minutes, with no acknowledgement, I actually called the hotel on my cellphone and asked if they might get some more help at the front desk (you would think the staff would be paying attention). I ended up waiting about 30 minutes to check in, and the line was very long behind me as i headed to the elevator

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: tntrvlngrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to the LAX airport, but didn't find anything else special about this hotel. The decor is dark, but It is clean and the staff is courteous. In the past 2 months we have stayed at the Hilton in Glendale, the Radisson in Santa Ana and the Grand Vista in Simi Valley, all at comparable prices and their rooms and bathrooms were more spacious.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay, thanks in large part to great staff”
Reviews.Author: poetrypartners
Reviews.Content: Loads of All-Star Game basketball fans, a sorority conference, a biker gathering, a wedding, and a large contigent of Japanese tourists. That's not the punchline to a bad joke. It's what was at the Radisson during my stay, and it made for an unforgettable weekend (in a good way!). The fact that the Radisson staff dealt professionally with a full house of such diverse clientele and did so with a smile says a lot about this hotel. Every staffer I encountered, from the valet to the front desk to the waiter to the housekeeper, was very pleasant and seemed to really care that every guest had an enjoyable stay. Requests for extra towels or retrieval of my car from valet were met promptly and with courtesy that one might not expect from a highly trafficked airport hotel. Check-in and check-out were smooth and painless. My hotel room faced the south runway, and at first, I was concerned about airplane noise, but noise wasn't a problem at all -- I heard NO airplanes at all! The room was very comfortable and well-appointed. My roomie and I enjoyed the free wi-fi and the availability of an in-room refrigerator. The only drawback was the bed, which was one of those Sleep Number outfits. I'd never slept on one, and after two nights of fiddling with settings, I'm not in a hurry to sleep in one again. The bed seemed very squishy, even on a "firm" setting. Thankfully, the hotel provided plenty of pillows, so I was able to arrange them in a way that provided my back with sufficient support. I enjoyed my weekend at the Radisson and would have no qualms about returning. The staff there is really great, and they deserve kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: trvlmaven
Reviews.Content: Most of my reviews have a theme- know what you are getting into. The Radisson is an airport hotel- so, the amenities may not be great, however, I found the rooms (I'll get to that) clean and comfortable. One issue- could not figure out the Sleep Number bed, and therefore it was a little uncomfortable. Nice lobby and bar. But the thing that stands out is the customer service. We checked in and went to our room. Put the ac on, and it was blowing hot air. Gave it a little time, but it still was not working. Called the front desk, and they sent a bellhop up right away with another room key. Went to the new room, turned on the TV, and it wasn't working. I went down to the lobby to get a new room. Benny was working the desk- he took my key and gave me another room- he commented, "I think you will like this room." And he was right- a beautiful suite on the top floor- spacious living and dining room, great features- big screen TV, etc. We enjoyed the room very much! I appreciate Benny going above and beyond the call of duty. One downside- no self-parking, only valet. But the lot is only a short block away, so not that big of a deal. Radisson is a nice hotel if you are stopping over at LAX, and it is even good for checking out other parts of LA, since it is pretty centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Better to walk than take the airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: imac4444
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel for an overnight while awaiting a flight. The shuttle from the terminal is a bit slow and stops at several other hotels first, so, you're in for a long ride. In the morning, the shuttle to the airport was full and looked like it would be for several more rides. Coming every 20 minutes, this was not acceptable, and wouldn't allow me to catch my flight in time, so I walked. Yep, dragging your luggage from the airport to the terminal is faster thatn taking the shuttle. If you book on an aggregator, like Expedia, your room price will not include breakfast. Room was fine, staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Mom traveling with 13 year old Daughter”
Reviews.Author: dkmorales
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay that was simi close to UCLA Medical Center. It was about 15 minutes drive time and that was close enough for me.
