On check out they wanted to charge me for valet parking (something like $14) until I reminded them that the "self" was full and I didn't have any options. Check in was somewhat of a nightmare as the system had "crashed". It seemed as though the system must frequently crash as they had a system worked out with walkie talkies and paper cards to determine who got what room. Truly bizarre! We had to wait about 40 mins to be given a room. There were 4 of us so no we couldn't snuggle into a king bed room!! I had booked at the Radisson for the pool & hot tub for the kids but we had a hard time finding it and it was so dark and scary that they wouldn't go near it. The room was quite small though it had a good view of LA from the 9th floor with a little airport noise but not bad. They did quickly bring a rollaway once I reminded them about it. Come to think of it I don't think they charged me for the rollaway. We didn't pay much for the room $69 so that was a plus and we used room service which came pretty quickly and was fairly reasonable and tasty. They had a very big room service menu with lots of casual choices which was great for the teenage kids. I didn't frankly feel safe enough in the area around the hotel to walk outside with an older person and kids to find somewhere else to eat and besides we wanted to watch the Oscars on TV! The shuttle worked out well and the staff was generally friendly. I was surprised that they did not offer express check out though. If you can get the room at a cheap rate then I wouldn't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Good, convenient arrival hotel”
Reviews.Author: mopezone
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit puzzled by some of the bad reviews posted about this hotel. We arrived after a very long flight with a pre-paid (very cheap!) booking made in England. The hotel shuttle from LAX was prompt, quick and courteous. Check in staff were friendly, smiley and got us rooms that we wanted without any bribery (I think Americans call it tipping!) probably because we were friendly right back at them. Because we were travelling with teenage kids they gave us rooms with a connecting door which made life much easier. The rooms were spacious, clean and quiet, with great views of the runways, although soundproofing was so good that you couldn't hear the planes. We stayed for 3 nights and found everyone extremely helpful and the hotel very comfortable. I've only given 4 stars because self parking was $12 a night and frankly it should be free, and also because the shower in one of our rooms was temperamental and not up to the fire-hose standard that we expect and enjoy in American hotels. Not so bad that we had to call for service, though. Check out was simple. I'd certainly start here on my next visit to LA, and I might even stay here for the whole time, as with the freeways it's a pretty convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “A MUst Place to Stayt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Radisson has the absolute friendliest staff of any hotel in Los Angeles. The Palmira restaurant had the best food in West Los Angeles. You must eat in this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: vulk
Reviews.Content: We were extremely dissapoinited in our stay at Radisson Hotel near LAX. Despite having a guranteed late night arrival, our reserved non-smoking room was given away, so we had no choice but to accept a smoking room. Tried to get some rest after a long flight, but it was impossible, because of very loud and drunk next door neighboors who talked loudly in the hallway all night long. At 3am we could't take it any more and called the hotel security. The security guard asked them to settle down, but to no avail. At some point we fell asleep only to be awaken at 7 am by the sound of a vacuum sweeper and the room service staff who started their early day's work. The whole experience was unbelievable and the hotel performed miserably in the most basic element of service, such as providing a reliable, secure and quiet place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment plus!!”
Reviews.Author: VICanada
Reviews.Content: Dec 14, 2004 -- Hot, noisy rooms, polite but, grumpy staff, dark (evening swim) and questionably-clean pool. We would not stay here again. I researched this hotel using this site. We wanted a nice place to stay to get a good night's sleep before our 8am flight. We did not. The room is very hot and air conditioner noisier than you would expect. Lots of hallway and adjacent room noise. No coffee available in the room and restaurant desk girl could not find the cream or change for me. It is close to airport but, you'd be better off finding another hotel for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there because it was close to the airport. Obviously, that is this Hotel's only plus and they drive that point home every chance they get. The room was substandard. The was a smarmy guy at the front desk that just stood around acting smug, looking lazy. I asked the girl checking us in if he was the manager and she concurred. It gave me a bad impression from the start. We grabbed breakfast in their restaurant but I didn't eat much of it because I don't do well on cheap, bland food. The staff barely acknowleded us. This place is bland and depressing. Definitely not trying to woo anyone back for a second stay. We heard from the shuttle driver that the Westin is nice. We will book that next time.

Reviews.Title: “LAX Raddison Stay”
Reviews.Author: nd83cheg
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at the Raddison at LAX on October 19, 2004. The hotel can certainly claim its proximity to the airport, and the price wasn't bad. However overall there was nothing about the Raddison that stood out as exceptional. The shuttle that picks you up at the airport was adequate; the lobby of the hotel was very nice. The checkin process was efficient given the number of people checking in at once. The room however was adequate at best. The furniture and the carpeting looked like they were ready to be replaced. The bathroom was rather small and standard. One major drawback was the lack of a coffee pot in the room. It seems that most hotels now do include a coffee pot in the room, even the Super-8 style motels, yet the Radisson didn't. Checkout process was relatively quick also, although I was surprised that express checkout wasn't a standard option. For the price and convenience to LAX, the Radisson was ok, but certainly not somewhere where I would stay for more than a few hours overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Typical airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: The_curious_limper
Reviews.Content: Nothing special - a pretty average airport hotel. Bathroom seemed a bit dated and I was waiting for what seemed an age for the shuttle to collect me from the airport. The TV in the room didn't work properly - it looked like their system had crashed. Breakfast was expensive for what it was. Ok for one night but n ot much more.
